subject: Re: [junit] ETA?
msgSnippet: True, but a third-party extension that did so (it would be a subclass of org.junit.runner.Request) would work seamlessly with the rest of JUnit 4. David Saff
messageBody:
True, but a third-party extension that did so (it would be a subclass of
org.junit.runner.Request) would work seamlessly with the rest of JUnit 4.

David Saff

Alexandru Popescu wrote:

> afaik JUnit 4 has no intention to do this. At least this is the last
> answer I've read on this matter.
>
> ./alex
> --
> .w( the_mindstorm )p.
>
>
